metadata.title: CVE-2019-18634 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In Sudo before 1.8.26, if pwfeedback is enabled in /etc/sudoers, users cantrigger a stack-based buffer overflow in the privileged sudo process.(pwfeedback is a default setting in Linux Mint and elementary OS; however,it is NOT the default for upstream and many other packages, and would existonly if enabled by an administrator.) The attacker needs to deliver a longstring to the stdin of getln() in tgetpass.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18634` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sudo - 1.8.21p2-3ubuntu1.2
sudo-ldap - 1.8.21p2-3ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sudo package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.21p2-3ubuntu1.2').
